Ethmi

Feel free to share your opinions, remember to say why you think certain forms of entertainment should be banned. Also keep in mind that votes on this poll are public, so don't vote if you want to contribute your opinion anonymously.
 
 In my personal opinion, nothing should be banned. I can understand why some things should be censored from younger crowds, but to completely ban a form of entertainment is unethical. As long as nothing illegal is done in the making of the entertainment, then it should be legal.

Pornography, should be banned. However I don't think that it should be banned for everyone, just public places that minors visit (i.e. Library, School, etc.), because it would be subjecting their minds to explicit material, that I personally don't believe that anyone should be watching, even though some people love watching it.
 
 I also think that bands like Blood on the Dance Floor should be banned. Again, I think that it should just be banned from public places that minors often visit, for said reason above.
 
 And, if the idea of banning it from public places is so repulsive, I think that the adults that wish to view such a thing, should obtain cards, and then bring their own computers to said places, and sit in remote corners so that minors still have no way of viewing them.

ICD Press

I would like the people who read this question the Institute for Cultural Diplomacy to our event in Berlin on the 17th of February. 
 The Language of Art and Music: 
 "An International Symposium on the Potential for Artistic Expression to Cross Cultural Barriers" 
 (International Conference, Berlin, 17th - 20th February, 2011) 
 
 The use of culture and art to promote dialogue and understanding is a field that, though the subject of much scholarly attention, has had little impact on the behavior and activities of national governments and other stakeholders in international relations. Moreover, whilst there is a widespread agreement of the value of culture and art in raising awareness of cultural differences, there is less understanding of the potential for culture and art to offer a neutral platform for mutual cultural exchange, to transform cultural differences and unite people through emotions. "The Language of Art and Music" will work to bridge the gap between theory and practice by bringing together artists with academic experts from the field and key figures in international relations to discuss the importance of these artistic disciplines.
 
 Check out the website and see if your interested in joining this discussion!
